{"step_by_step_thinking": "The first child is able to lift his head and chest when in the prone position, and he can track an object with his eyes to the midline. His hands remain fisted 50% of the time. These are developmental milestones typically achieved by 2 months of age. The second child can roll from supine to prone and can transfer her rattle from hand to hand. She cannot yet say any words. These are developmental milestones typically achieved by 6 months of age. The third child is starting to explore the world around him and has begun taking independent steps at home. He seems to recognize the name of several objects, but he cannot follow the direction to “grab the ball.” These are developmental milestones typically achieved by 12 months of age.", "answer_choice": "D. Ages 2 months, 6 months, and 12 months"}
